instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7105: What is D7105? Diodes between PPDCIN_G3H charger voltage and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, when CHGR_DCIN Is low(less than charger voltage) and PPBUS_G3H is missing this is a critical point to troubleshoot.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no green/orange light on magsafe charger
threads.message:
hello everyone i have <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> cant charge on normal charger totally no light i change already the charging port but when im using my psu with by-3200 cable it works fine
btw i changed the :
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
<DIODE>D7105</DIODE>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>
<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> all these came from working board but same problem
hope somebody can help me
thanks in advance...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no green/orange light on magsafe charger
threads.message:
Original charger is smart enough to detect leakage and gets blocked.
Usually <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, or <DIODE>D7010</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no green/orange light on magsafe charger
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 75210, member: 682"]
<DIODE>D7010</DIODE>
[/QUOTE]
problem solved by replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>
thanks [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER]. your the man.. :)
